title: EIM13005 - Termination payments andbenefits: types of payment within Section 401 ITEPA 2003

details.body:
Compensation for loss of office or employment ("golden handshakes").This represents compensation for loss of the employment. It will often be calculated as damages (see [EIM13070](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13070.htm)). Payments are sometimes mistakenly called compensation for loss of office. In particular, if a payment has its source in the terms of employment it is not compensation for loss of employment, but rather earnings from the employment chargeable under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM00630](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM00630.htm) to EIM00635, [EIM12850](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12850.htm) and [EIM13920](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13920.htm)). Compensation for loss of employment by reason of redundancy will always be within Section 401 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM13750](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13750.htm)). If compensation appears excessive, see [EIM12852](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12852.htm).
Salary or wages in lieu of notice.Section 401 ITEPA 2003 applies where the employee is entitled only to notice but the employer fails or refuses to give it (see [EIM12978](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12978.htm)). **Note** that Section 62 ITEPA 2003 applies if the terms and conditions of employment are the source of the payment (see [EIM12976](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12976.htm)) or if there is a custom or practice (see [EIM12977](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12977.htm)).
Damages for breach of contract of employment.Section 401 ITEPA 2003 applies if the payment or benefit is compensation for cancellation of the service agreement (see [EIM13922](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13922.htm)). See [EIM13070](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13070.htm) regarding the proper calculation of damages.
Redundancy payments.See [EIM13750](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13750.htm).
Certain compensation paid under the Employment Rights Act 1996.See [EIM12950](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM12950.htm).
** Note** that: * a gratuity given on or after retirement is taxed under Section 394 ITEPA 2003 in priority to Section 401 ITEPA 2003, see [EIM15000](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM15000.htm) and subsequent guidance * a lump sum to commute (replace) a pension or pension rights may be excepted (see [EIM13660](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13660.htm)) or, in the case of a payment to commute pensions from non-approved or employer-financed retirement benefits scheme, chargeable under Section 394 ITEPA 2003 (see [EIM15000](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM15000.htm)). Payments chargeable under Section 401 ITEPA 2003 are subject to certain exceptions and reductions, see [EIM13500](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM13500.htm).
